item.description:
Blue Hills Maple Sugar Days
Join us as we make syrup in the traditional way at beautiful Brookwood Farm. Put on your boots and mittens and join in the fun! Smell the wood smoke as you watch the clouds of steam rise from the bubbling sap. Savor the taste of real maple syrup. Enjoy a wagon ride for an additional fee. Activities for all ages.
Blue Hills Maple Sugar Days is a joint program of the DCR and the Massachusetts Audubon Society and a fee is charged:
$5.00 Adult
$3.00 Children 3-12 (Ages 2 & under free)

All proceeds to benefit the Trailside Museum.
For more information, please call (617) 698-1802 or (617) 333-0690.
For event parking, take exit 3 off Rte. 93in Milton. At the end of the ramp, follow signs for Maple Sugar Days parking.

Meet in the parking lot at 11:00

We will check out the maple sugar production for an hour then go for a hour's walk around Houghton's Pond. Afterwards we will head to the 99 Restaurant for lunch.
item.name: Blue Hills Maple Sugar Days, walk & lunch
